Are we missing something?Apparently, Citibank just had a roadshow at SMU. The Citi Clear Card was being promoted to students.  The card has no minimum spending, no income required. Brandan Chen, Financial Planner at Manulife SingaporeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 27 Aug 2018Nope you are not missing anything. This card is specifically target at tertiary students, hence no minimum income or spending. If i do not recall wrongly, they will be able to provide a credit limit of 500 per month.​Aim for such credit cards is to collect data from students, and when they finally graduate and start working, they will be able to qualify for the other CITIBANK cards.​Each bank has their own student credit card​0 comments2
